articles.title: Russian Orthodox Church Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Russian Orthodox Church Delegation Arrives

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A Russian Orthodox Church delegation headed by Yegorievsk Archbishop Mark who is chairman of the Committee for Coordinating Overseas Institutions of the church arrived here on Friday to take part in the event to mark the fifth anniversary of the opening of Jongbaek Church.

articles.title: Chairman of KFA Visits Pyongyang Mission of AINDF
articles.content:
Chairman of KFA Visits Pyongyang Mission of AINDF

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain, and his party Friday visited the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front on a visit to the DPRK.
					
					Chief Jo Il Min and officials of the mission met and had a talk with them.
					
					At the talk, he and the KFA chairman informed each other of their activities and discussed the issue of boosting solidarity activities in the future.
					
					Jo Il Min referred to the fact that progressive media and Internet websites in south Korea are widely introducing the greatness of leader Kim Jong Il these days.
					
					He informed the guests that owing to the fabrication of "spy ring case" and frantic north-targeted war exercises in south Korea, the inter-Korean relations have reached an extreme phase of confrontation and the people's struggle for the right to existence has become fierce.
					
					Alejandro Cao de Benos stressed that he would continue to support and encourage the AINDF and the south Korean people in their struggle for the implementation of the historic north-south joint declaration and independence, democracy and reunification.
					
					He issued a statement condemning the U.S. and the south Korean authorities for their projected Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises.
					
					The statement urged them to drop foolish daydream to stifle the DPRK by force of arms, branding this saber-rattling extremely dangerous criminal act.
					
					The statement noted that the KFA would fully support the Korean people in their just cause of defending peace and security in solidarity with all the progressive forces and anti-war peace organizations in the world.

articles.title: Russian Ambassador Gives Reception on Anniversary of Korea's Liberation
articles.content:
Russian Ambassador Gives Reception on Anniversary of Korea's Liberation

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery E. Sukhinin Friday gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
					
					Present there on invitation were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned.
					
					Present there were the Russian Orthodox Church delegation headed by Yegorievsk Archbishop Mark who is chairman of the Committee for Coordinating Overseas Institutions of the church and staff members of the Russian embassy here.
					
					Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Ad Exhibits Hit in DPRK
articles.content:
Ad Exhibition Begins in DPRK

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang international exhibition of new products and trade advertisements opened Friday at the Pyongyang International Cultural Centre.
					
					The centre houses samples of some 7 000 new products, including foodstuffs, daily necessities and food-processing machines, as well as their catalogues and trade and investment advertisements. The products were made on the basis of technologies of China and other countries.
					
					Director of the Korean Advertisement Company Kim Hak told KCNA that the exhibition, to be held through the year, displays new goods and trade advertisements and provides favorable conditions for exchange of new products, joint venture, collaboration, investment and development.
					
					The exhibition will be conducive to invigorating economic cooperation and trade among nations, he said.
					
					It draws attention from local and foreign scientists, technicians and businessmen.

articles.title: Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
articles.content:
Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery Draws Endless Stream of Visitors

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong is visited by an endless stream of people to mark the anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					The cemetery is a monumental edifice in our era which reflects the firm will of the Korean people to preserve and carry forward the brilliant revolutionary traditions of the anti-Japanese struggle and to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche generation after generation, the cause that started in the forest of Mt. Paektu.
					
					The cemetery was rebuilt on an expansion basis on the 40th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					More than 34.9 million servicepersons, people from all walks of life, school youth and children, overseas compatriots and foreigners have visited the cemetery over the past 26 years since then.

articles.title: DPRK Players Prove Successful in Int'l Aero Model Contest
articles.content:
DPRK Players Prove Successful in Int'l Aero Model Contest

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Players of the DPRK proved successful at the 2011 International Aero Model Contest for Mongolia Cup in Ulan Baator, Mongolia.
					
					The contest brought together more than 120 good players from the DPRK, China, Russia and other countries and region.
					
					DPRK players came first in the team event of large-class glider.
					
					Ri Kwang Il placed first in the individual event of middle-class glider and Kim Won Chol came second in the large- and middle-class events and Paek Ri Hyok finished third in the middle-class event.

articles.title: Gem Cutting Craftwork Presented to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gem Cutting Craftwork Presented to Kim Jong Il

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- On display is a gem cutting craftwork at the International Friendship Exhibition House in the DPRK.
					
					It is a gift the general manager of a Hong Kong business group presented to leader Kim Jong Il in November Juche 86 (1997).
					
					The general manager was much touched by news stories that the leader was invariably pursuing popular policies though the DPRK was in a difficult economic condition.
					
					The businessman decided to present a family treasure to him as a gift.
					
					The craftwork, patterned with bird, crane and sea, contains wishes for the leader's good health.

articles.title: Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm Admired by Foreigners
articles.content:
Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm Admired by Foreigners

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm in Pyongyang attracts admiration from foreign visitors.
					
					After visiting the farm, Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, said the farm is associated with benevolent politics pursued by leader Kim Jong Il and that such an amazing farm can never be found in other countries.
					
					Anders Karlsson, chairman of the Communist Party of Sweden, said the farm offers a glimpse of Kim Jong Il's strenuous effort for providing the people with a happy life, as well as advantages of the socialist economy.
					
					It is incredible that this large and wonderful fruit farm was built in only three years. 
					
					Mamoru Kitahara, chairman of the Fukuoka Prefectural Association for JapanÔºçDPRK Friendship, said he deemed it a great honor to visit the fruit farm at a time when the Korean people were striving hard to build a thriving nation. 
					
					He congratulated the Korean people on the tremendous achievements they made under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Geothermal Resources in Wide Use
articles.content:
Geothermal Resources in Wide Use

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Tapping and utilizing geothermal resources has become a worldwide trend along with the scientific and technological development and growing demand for energy.
					
					An effective and electricity-saving heating system based on geothermal pump has been introduced in some countries.
					
					An air-conditioning system based on geothermal pump was applied to buildings of 3 120 000 square metres in Nanning City, China last year. 
					
					About 2 000 kWh was needed to air-condition a university cafeteria in the city for 8 hours in summer.
					
					But the geotherm-based air conditioning system consumes only 630 kWh in the same time. 
					
					What is more important is that the use of geothermal energy does not pollute soil, while reducing carbon dioxide emissions.
					
					The Icelandic capital city of Reykjavik has established geotherm-supplying networks throughout the city to provide its citizens with hot water and hot air.
					
					Reykjavik is called a pollution-free city.
					
					The DPRK is directing effort to utilizing geothermal resources in economic sectors.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Dangerous Ulji Freedom Guardian
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Dangerous Ulji Freedom Guardian
						

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities are contemplating staging massive Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises from August 16 to 26 in collusion with the United States.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Friday says in a bylined article in this regard:
					
					The warmongers claim the aim of exercises is to strengthen the "combat posture of the south Korea-U.S. alliance" in a bid to "cope with and overcome all threats". But, with no rhetoric can they cover up their aggressive and dangerous nature.
					
					The said exercises will be an undisguised military threat to the DPRK and a wanton challenge to the peace on the Korean Peninsula as they are a full revelation of the invariable policy of the warmongers at home and abroad for escalating the confrontation with it. 
					
					They, at the same time, prove that those forces do not want to see detente and peace on the Korean Peninsula but are set to realize their scenario for invading the DPRK in collusion with outside forces.
					
					With the appearance of the conservative regime in south Korea the inter-Korean relations which had favorably developed since the adoption of the June 15 declaration deteriorated all of a sudden and are getting tenser as the days go by. 
					
					The joint military exercises against the north projected under such situation would further aggravate the already strained situation on the peninsula and increase the danger of a nuclear war.
					
					History goes to clearly prove that military exercises of any form in south Korea would deteriorate the inter-Korean relations and throw stumbling blocks in the way of the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					As the Panmunjom mission of the Korean People's Army demanded in a recent open letter to the U.S. and the south Korean authorities, the projected war exercises against the north should be canceled as they vitiate the atmosphere of dialogue and escalate the confrontation and tension on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Military's Anti-DPRK Confrontation Racket Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Military's Anti-DPRK Confrontation Racket Slammed

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea today issued information bulletin No. 978 denouncing the south Korean military for kicking off the anti-DPRK conspiratorial moves while blustering in a far-fetched manner that the DPRK fired shells into the waters near Yonphyong Island.
					
					The information said:
					
					As already reported, the puppet warmongers have kicked off another anti-DPRK conspiratorial confrontation racket such as opening fire all of a sudden, while groundlessly asserting that the DPRK shelled the waters near Yonphyong Island.
					
					The head of the north side to the north-south military working-level talks revealed the truth about the case and their sinister attempt. However, they are persisting in the conspiratorial moves, claiming that gun report was actually heard and they confirmed the points of impact through sound detecting devices.
					
					This reminds one of the saying that fear gives wings.
					
					In the past the puppet group described the blasting for the construction of a power station in Ryanggang Province of the DPRK as "mushroom cloud" and "nuclear test" only to be shamed. It also called a timber floating in the East Sea of Korea as a submarine of the north and let warship and flying corps shell and bomb it only to be ridiculed by the world.
					
					Last year when the warship sinking case occurred, it announced that it detected a submarine of the north on its way back from duty by a radar only to be ridiculed after it was proven to be a flock of birds. Some days ago, it misjudged its passenger airline as "enemy plane" and fired at it, astonishing people.
					
					The current shelling case is nothing but an extension of such burlesque.
					
					The puppet group did not discern the blasting from the gun report as it was greatly engrossed in escalating confrontation and breeding plots.
					
					It is unbecoming for the puppet military warmongers not to discern the blasting at the construction site of the Ryongmaedo Tideland within call from Yonphyong Island which is far from the depth of the DPRK though they were closely watching round the clock the areas of the DPRK side with the latest war means and detecting devices they brought from their U.S. master.
					
					They even blustered that they confirmed through sound detector the DPRK's shells dropping near the "northern limit line" even though they were not fired at all. This is ridiculous enough to provoke side-splitting laughter.
					
					The current case clearly proved that all the "cases" for which the puppet group blamed the DPRK in the past were fabricated in such a manner.
					
					The rackets kicked off by the puppet warmongers fully show how much they have been engrossed in intrigues, provocation, confrontation and war moves.
					
					Recently the puppet group kicked off conspiratorial rackets over "spyring case" and "dispatch of assassination team".
					
					Its provocative conspiratorial moves are aimed at faking up another shocking case in the wake of that of last year to chill the atmosphere for the improvement of the inter-Korean relations running higher day by day on the threshold of August 15, maintain the confrontation policy, divert elsewhere the public attention from the internal crisis and stymie the efforts to defuse the tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					The current case should never go unnoticed as it indicates that even a blasting for the peaceful construction can lead to a war in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					Now that the puppet military warmongers granted the frontline units the "right to fire without asking", it is as clear as noonday that the situation on the peninsula can turn into a war phase in a moment if they fire at random in the future, self-frightened like this time.
					
					If the U.S.-made detecting devices the puppet army is equipped with are poor ones which do not discern blasting from shelling, it is also very dangerous.
					
					Some days ago, it was found in the command control computer system of the Joint Chiefs of Staff of the puppet army that dozens of its units in the areas along the Military Demarcation Line are described as being stationed in the areas of the north side. This has sparked off a big furor. Such things can never go unnoticed.
					
					It is, indeed, horrible to think about the catastrophic consequences to be entailed by the ridiculous conspiratorial and confrontation rackets of the puppet group.
					
					Now the puppet warmongers seem to become insane, engrossed in persecution mania plus confrontation mania.
					
					If the puppet group does not want self-destruction, it had better cool its head overheated with confrontational ambition, act with discretion and give up the foolish anti-DPRK conspiratorial moves and reckless moves for a war against the DPRK.

articles.title: U.S. and Its Followers Hit for Wrongly Marking East Sea of Korea
articles.content:
U.S. and Its Followers Hit for Wrongly Marking East Sea of Korea

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore on August 9 carried an editorial accusing foreign forces of their unilateral move to mark the East Sea of Korea as "Japan Sea".
					
					The U.S. and its followers recently submitted to an international organization an official view that the East Sea of Korea should be marked as "Japan Sea", the editorial recalled.
					
					The designation of "Japan Sea" was registered in an international document in 1929 for the first time as insisted by Japanese imperialists and this can hardly be found in the world maps published earlier, it noted, and went on:
					
					Japan is talking about usage in connection with the appearance of the designation along with its past history of aggression and there is an increasing international tendency of marking the sea as the East Sea of Korea in recent years.
					
					The U.S. attitude of siding with Japan this time adversely affects this international trend.
					
					This attitude on the part of the U.S. which south Korea claims has an alliance with it cannot be interpreted otherwise than south Korea's diplomatic failure. The designation of "Japan Sea" should never be allowed.

articles.title: Heavy Rain Lashes North Jolla Province, S. Korea
articles.content:
Heavy Rain Lashes North Jolla Province, S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Heavy rain lashed North Jolla Province, south Korea on August 9, causing damage, according to south Korean KBS.
					
					It heavily rained all day long from dawn, registering over 400 mm in Jongup alone, an all-time high in 41 years. 
					
					Different villages were inundated.
					
					The recent heavy rain left more than 1 500 inhabitants homeless in the province. It also caused landslide, cutting roads and railways.

articles.title: Abolition of Alliance with U.S. Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Abolition of Alliance with U.S. Demanded in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Committee for Promoting the August 15 Meeting for Independent Reunification held a press conference outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul on August 9 denouncing the U.S. for supporting Japan's moves to grab Tok Islets.
					
					Speakers at the press conference accused the U.S. government of submitting to an international organization an official stand that the East Sea of Korea should be marked as "Japan Sea".
					
					This is a dangerous attitude backing Japan's claim to Tok Islets, they charged.
					
					They demanded the U.S. retract its stand marking "Japan Sea" and opt for abolishing the alliance with south Korea and withdrawing its troops from south Korea.
					
					The Headquarters of the Movement for the Withdrawal of the U.S. Forces in a commentary that day noted:  The fact that the U.S. has so far stood on the side of Japan over this issue as the very one which caused the Tok Islets case confirmed that there is no need to maintain the south Korea-U.S. alliance any longer. 
					
					The present "government" should abolish the alliance with the U.S. and make all the U.S. forces withdrawn from south Korea, the commentary urged.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Politics Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Politics Praised Abroad

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Events were held in various countries on August 4 and 6 to mark the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership and the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation. They included a meeting in Switzerland and a seminar in Mexico.
					
					Exhibited in their venues were famous works of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and books and photos on immortal Songun leadership feats.
					
					The chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee who doubles as chairman of the Preparatory Committee for the Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung said Kim Jong Il started his Songun revolutionary leadership on August 25, 1960 with the firm will to accomplish the revolutionary cause pioneered by Kim Il Sung with arms. 
					
					He went on.
					
					The DPRK has grown strong to be a bulwark of socialism with its invincible revolutionary forces and powerful nuclear deterrent and won one victory after another, smashing the provocations and the machinations for aggression of the U.S. imperialists and their lackeys under the wise Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					The chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism highly praised Kim Jong Il as a peerless Songun commander leading the Korean revolution and global independence to victory by dint of Songun politics.
					
					He also referred to the essence, validity and vitality of Songun politics.
					
					Meanwhile, an opening ceremony of a DPRK book, photo and handcraft exhibition took place in Russia and round-table talks in Romania on July 30 and August 1 respectively on the 51st anniversary of Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting in Switzerland.

articles.title: Russian Paper Observes Anniversary of DPRK-Russia Moscow Declaration
articles.content:
Russian Paper Observes Anniversary of DPRK-Russia Moscow Declaration

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The 29th issue of Russian paper Patriot specially edited an article titled "In interests of Russian and Korean peoples" illustrated with a photo of leader Kim Jong Il on the 10th anniversary of his historic visit to the Russian Federation and the adoption of the DPRK-Russia Moscow Declaration.
					
					The declaration referred to the peaceful missile program of the DPRK and the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea and Russia expressed understanding of these issues and underlined the need to ensure peace and security on the Korean Peninsula by nonmilitary means, the paper said, and went on:
					
					The adoption of the declaration evoked worldwide response little short of firing of a nuclear missile at the U.S.
					
					Russia and the DPRK have a long history and tradition of friendly relations and a summit meeting and talks between the two countries were successfully held in a friendly and open-hearted atmosphere.
					
					The reality today patently proves the Russia-DPRK Moscow declaration put a brake on the implementation of the U.S. strategy for unchallenged world domination and greatly encouraged the world community in its efforts to build a multi-polar world, it stressed.
					
					It edited the full text of the declaration.

articles.title: No One Can Bring down DPRK: Nepali Paper
articles.content:
No One Can Bring down DPRK: Nepali Paper

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Nepali paper Jana Sata on August 6 carried an article headlined "Those who want collapse of the DPRK cannot evade self-destruction" with a photo of President Kim Il Sung standing together with leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Much upset by the growing might of socialist Korea, the imperialists scheme to bring it to collapse, the paper said, and went on:
					
					The Korean people are working hard to build a rich and powerful country while foiling all the moves of the enemy and overcoming the repeated natural disasters.
					
					The DPRK has laid a solid foundation of the independent national economy and bolstered up military muscle despite the imperialists' pressure and threats.
					
					No one on earth can bring down the DPRK as long as there is Kim Jong Il who turned the DPRK into a country that had access to nukes by successfully carrying forward the cause of Kim Il Sung who ended the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists and liberated Korea.
					
					As it steers the world politics its own way and advances along the path desired by the people and the nation, the DPRK will never collapse no matter what misinformation the West and its followers may spread.

articles.title: Manuel Pinto Da Costa Elected President of Sao Tome and Principe
articles.content:
Manuel Pinto Da Costa Elected President of Sao Tome and Principe

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Manuel Pinto Da Costa was elected president of Sao Tome and Principe.
					
					He got overwhelming majority votes in the presidential election held on August 7, a press report said.

articles.title: ASEAN Plays Significant Role: Vietnamese PM
articles.content:
ASEAN Plays Significant Role: Vietnamese PM

					Pyongyang, August12 (KCNA) -- Vietnamese Prime Minister Nguyen Tan Dung highlighted the role of ASEAN in maintaining regional peace and development ahead of the 44th anniversary of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) on Aug. 8.
					
					He said ASEAN has actually become an important and indispensable factor for peace, stability and development in Southeast Asia, and a momentum to promote dialogue, cooperation and connectivity in the East Asian and Asian-Pacific regions.
					
					He called upon ASEAN member nations to cooperate with each other and make more positive efforts to implement the roadmap to build the ASEAN Community.

articles.title: Metro Construction in Chongqing, China
articles.content:
Metro Construction in Chongqing, China

					Beijing, August 11 (KCNA) -- Chongqing Municipality of China finished the first-stage project of its first metro recently.
					
					The section linking the eastern area of the municipality with its western area is 15.7 km long.
					
					The municipality is planning to build more sections of metro before 2013 and pushing forward the project.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Yunnan Province, China
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Yunnan Province, China

					Beijing, August 11 (KCNA) -- A 5.2-magintude earthquake occurred at the juncture area of Tengchong County and Longyang District in Baoshan City, Yunnan Province, China on August 9.
					
					The epicenter was 22 km from the county seat.

articles.title: Aircraft Carrier Hull Tested in China
articles.content:
Aircraft Carrier Hull Tested in China

					Beijing, August 11 (KCNA) -- A test sailing of China's first aircraft carrier hull was conducted Wednesday.
					
					The test was reported by the Chinese People's Daily.

articles.title: China Takes Measures to Cope with Global Financial Crisis
articles.content:
China Takes Measures to Cope with Global Financial Crisis

					Beijing, August 11 (KCNA) -- Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao presided over a State Council meeting on Tuesday to analyze the international financial situation and its consequences and study relevant measures. 
					
					The meeting, to cope with the serious condition of the international financial market, called for maintaining the continuity and stability of the macroeconomic policy, reducing the scope of price hike and promoting a stable and rapid economic growth.

articles.title: China Warns of Misunderstanding of Military Exercise
articles.content:
China Warns of Misunderstanding of Military Exercise

					Beijing, August 11 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of National Defense of China Tuesday said that mass media should not misunderstand an annual exercise of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (CPLA).
					
					Some media reported that many CPLA units gathered at the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, linking it with the situation of the south sea.
					
					In an article posted on its website, the ministry said some Guangzhou-based units conducted an annual exercise.
					
					The article urged media to refrain from misunderstanding the exercise.

articles.title: Japan's "China Threat Theory" Refuted
articles.content:
Japan's "China Threat Theory" Refuted

					Beijing, August 11 (KCNA) -- Chinese experts refuted the "China threat theory" highlighted in Japan's latest "Defense White Paper".
					
					An expert of the China Institute of Contemporary International Relations said "maritime threat" is the key point of the "China threat" advertised by Japan in this year's "Defense White Paper" and that Japan, through the advertisement, seeks to awake neighboring nations to fears of "China threat".     
					
					A vice-director of the Institute of Japanese Affairs under the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences said China's "strong-arm policy" towards Japan and the United States, particularly the U.S.-Japan alliance, does not exist.
					
					"Does it conform to Japan's interests and expectation that China always remains in poor condition and should China stop progress and always remain backward to meet Japan's ill-natured expectation and desire?" the expert asked, terming such thinking pattern of Japan as hegemonic.
					
					An expert of the same institute accused Japan of taking a high-handed and overbearing attitude towards China.
					
					The experts urged Japan to refrain from spreading misinformation and imprudently surmising the prospect of bilateral relations.

articles.title: Americans Pessimistic about Economy: CNN Poll
articles.content:
Americans Pessimistic about Economy: CNN Poll

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Americans' pessimism about the nation's economy has skyrocketed in the past few months.
					
					Sixty percent of those polled said that the economy is still in a downturn and getting worse, expressing deep concern over this, a new CNN poll showed Monday.

articles.title: Police Brutality Sparks Public Outrage in U.S.
articles.content:
Police Brutality Sparks Public Outrage in U.S.

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Hundreds of people gathered Saturday in front of the police department in Fullerton city of Los Angeles to protest against police brutality that claimed the life of a schizophrenic man.
					
					They protested against the police for ruthlessly beating to death an innocent man and wanted those involved in the incident to be disciplined.

articles.title: Hackers Attack Websites of U.S. Law Enforcement Agencies
articles.content:
Hackers Attack Websites of U.S. Law Enforcement Agencies

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- An online hacker group, called AntiSec, claimed Saturday it had cracked data from websites of more than 70 law enforcement agencies in several U.S. states, including Arkansas and Louisiana.
					
					The group said it made the attack in retaliation for the arrests of alleged members in the United States and Britain.

articles.title: Stop to Gag on Press Called for by Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Stop to Gag on Press Called for by Koreans in Japan

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Choson Sinbo, organ of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, Wednesday carried an article titled "Stop at once suppression and conspiratorial racket against 'Minjok 21'".
					
					The article accused the south Korean authorities of kicking up recently a wholesale suppression racket against the magazine Minjok 21 on unreasonable charges that members of its editorial staff conducted espionage at the instruction of someone after being embraced by Koreans in Japan.
					
					This eloquently reveals the anti-reunification nature of the south Korean "government" to stamp out everything related to the June 15 joint declaration, it held.
					
					Recalling that the above-said magazine conducted fair and aboveboard news exchange with media run by Koreans in Japan, the article noted: The south Korean authorities, however, are charging the magazine with espionage and cracking down upon it on charges of violation of the "National Security Law." This self-exposes their sinister and politically-motivated purpose.
					
					It urged the south Korean authorities to stop at once the fascist suppression of all media and personages of political parties and organizations aspiring after peace and reunification.

articles.title: More Japan's Enterprises Go into Bankruptcy
articles.content:
More Japan's Enterprises Go into Bankruptcy

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Japan's more enterprises are going into bankruptcy due the economic crisis.
					
					The number of corporate failures rose 1.4 percent in July from a year earlier to 1 081, Tokyo Shoko Research Ltd. said Monday.
					
					Liabilities left by the bankrupt firms amounted to 220.91 billion yen.

articles.title: Peru Seizes 800 kg of Drugs
articles.content:
Peru Seizes 800 kg of Drugs

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Anti-drug police have seized 800 kg of drugs and arrested 151 drug-traffickers at an international airport in Peru so far this year, the country's police announced Sunday.

articles.title: Fran's RGC's Mission: Commander
articles.content:
Iran's RGC's Mission: Commander

					Tehran, August 11 (KCNA) -- Iran's Islamic Revolution Guards Corps commander, speaking at a ceremony on August 7, referred to the mission of the RGC.
					
					He said that defending the country against military threats is not the IRGC's only duty, but it is also obligated to counter economic and cultural threats.
					
					The RGC should press on with its leading role in economic front to steer the country through western sanctions and foreign pressure, he added.

articles.title: Iran Calls for Completing Oil Industry Nationalization
articles.content:
Iran Calls for Completing Oil Industry Nationalization

					Tehran, August 11 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, speaking at a ceremony on Tuesday, called for completing oil industry's nationalization in the country. 
					
					"Only one-third of the country's oil income is allocated to the Iranian nation while the remaining two-thirds are poured into the foreigners' pockets," the president regretted. 
					
					He said Iranians' present mission is to complete the last chains of the ring of oil industry's nationalization.

articles.title: Iran Censures West's Sanctions
articles.content:
Iran Censures West's Sanctions
						

					Tehran, August 11 (KCNA) -- The Iranian vice-president scathingly ridiculed the West's sanctions against his country.
					
					The sanctions have touched off complaint among companies in the Western countries, he said, adding they will end up in losing such a vast market as Iran.
					
					The West will be compelled to lift the sanctions against Iran sooner or later, he noted.

articles.title: Iran to Counter U.S., Israeli Cyber Attacks
articles.content:
Iran to Counter U.S., Israeli Cyber Attacks

					Tehran, August 11 (KCNA) -- Avaz Heidarpour, a member of the National Security and Foreign Policy Commission of Iran's Majlis (parliament), clarified the stand of the country to counter the U.S. and Israeli cyber attacks. He said this in an interview with a TV radio on August 8.
					
					He noted that the country's security and intelligence bodies have "very strong capabilities" to counter the enemies' cyber attacks. 
					
					If the U.S. and Israel seek to draw up a new plan to wage cyber attacks, Iran's security and intelligence bodies will immediately adopt an "appropriate and precise" stance, he warned.

articles.title: Cooperation of Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation of Different Countries

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Iran and Benin signed four Memoranda of Understanding (MoU) on boosting bilateral cooperation in the diplomatic and economic fields on Saturday.
					
					Russia and Iran signed a MoU on multimodal transportation between the two countries on August 4.

articles.title: Iraqi Cleric Warns U.S. Troops in Iraq
articles.content:
Iraqi Cleric Warns U.S. Troops in Iraq

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Muqtada al-Sadr, Iraqi Shiite cleric, on August 7 issued a statement warning the U.S. forces present in Iraq.
					
					If the U.S. forces stay past the Dec. 31, the withdrawal deadline, in Iraq, we will attack them by military means, the statement warned.
					
					Even a limited training mandate would not be acceptable to his Shiite militia, it noted.

articles.title: Zimbabwean President Vows to Continue Fight against Western Imperialism
articles.content:
Zimbabwean President Vows to Continue Fight against Western Imperialism
						

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Zimbabwean President Robert Mugabe vowed on Monday to continue fighting against Western imperialism. He said this in a speech to mark the Heroes' Day Holiday.
					
					Mugabe said the former colonial master is defiantly refusing to accept that Zimbabwe is now a sovereign country and so the struggle is on. 
					
					The present international situation served as a reminder and lesson for Zimbabwe and other African countries to guard against neocolonialism by the West, he said, urging Zimbabweans to remain vigilant and united in safeguarding the country's political independence and heritage.

articles.title: New Law to Protect Indigenous Group: South African President
articles.content:
New Law to Protect Indigenous Group: South African President
						

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- South African President Jacob Zuma, speaking at a ceremony in Cape Town on Sunday, referred to the government's policy of protecting the indigenous people. 
					
					Zuma said the South African government is conscious of the need to improve the economic, social and cultural situation of indigenous people.
					
					South Africa's oldest surviving indigenous group, the Khoi-San, will be protected by draft legislation to be finalized in September, he noted.

articles.title: EU Slams Israeli Plans for 900 New Homes
articles.content:
EU Slams Israeli Plans for 900 New Homes

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- European Union foreign policy chief Catherine Ashton in a recent statement condemned a wrong decision by Israel.
					
					The Israeli authorities decided to build about 900 Jewish dwelling houses in East Kuds. In this regard Ashton said the move undermined the efforts to revive Mideast peace talks.
					
					Ashton reiterated that all Israeli settlement activities were illegal under international law.
					
					The EU has repeatedly urged the Government of Israel to immediately end all settlement activities, she said.

articles.title: European Financial Crisis Likely to Affect Whole World
articles.content:
European Financial Crisis Likely to Affect Whole World

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Oly Len, member of the European Union for Economy and Finance, recently said in Brussels that the financial crisis that was going on in the euro zone could spread globally.
					
					The crisis now persists in Europe, but its scope and aftermath may affect the whole world, the official warned.

articles.title: Myanmar Reiterates Efforts for Regional Peace, Stability
articles.content:
Myanmar Reiterates Efforts for Regional Peace, Stability

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Myanmar reiterated on Monday its efforts for the maintenance of peace and stability in the ASEAN region. Myanmar President U Thein Sein said this in his congratulatory message to the 44th anniversary of ASEAN (Association of Southeast Asian Nations) Day.
					
					Referring to the efforts made by the government in the past to implement the roadmap for the ASEAN Community, he stressed that Myanmar will make every possible effort for the economic development, prosperity and well-being of all the ASEAN people in the future.

articles.title: Cuba Boosts Food Production
articles.content:
Cuba Boosts Food Production

					Havana, August 11 (KCNA) -- Cuba has paid much effort to boosting food production.
					
					Speaking at a recent meeting with a group of presidents of cooperatives in the central province of Ciego de Avila, the president of the National Association of Small Farmers, Orlando Lugo, called for increasing food production in Cuba to reduce imports.
					
					During the last five years Cuba has had to spend an average of 1.5 billion USD annually on food imports.

articles.title: Brazilian Finance Minister Warns of Global Economic Crisis
articles.content:
Brazilian Finance Minister Warns of Global Economic Crisis

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Brazilian Finance Minister Guido Mantega said Monday the global economic crisis entered a "chronic phase", citing the U.S. failure to stimulate its economy and Europe's inability to solve its internal problems.
					
					"The sharp falls in the stocks all over the world are caused by fears that the world is moving toward a recession", the minister said.

articles.title: Pakistan Wants New Relationship with India: FM
articles.content:
Pakistan Wants New Relationship with India: FM

					Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Pakistani Foreign Minister Hina Rabbani Khar on Tuesday called for improved ties with India.
					
					Speaking at the National Assembly, the foreign minister said Pakistan wants to build a new relationship with India through dialogue and cooperation.

articles.title: Alejandro Cao de Benos y su comitiva visitan sucursal coreana
articles.content:
Alejandro Cao de Benos y su comitiva visitan sucursal coreana

					Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad con Corea con sede en Espana, Alejandro Cao de Benos, y su comitiva realizaron el dia 12 una visita a la sucursal del Frente Democratico Nacional Antiimperialista en Pyongyang.
					
					Los visitantes fueron acogidos por el delegado Jo Il Min y otros integrantes de la sucursal, quienes departieron con los huespedes.
					
					En la ocasion se informo el estado de las actividades de sus respectivas organizaciones y se discutieron los problemas para fortalecer en el futuro las actividades solidarias.
					
					Jo se refirio a que las publicaciones progresistas y sitios web de Internet del Sur de Corea dan a conocer ampliamente la noble personalidad del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Anuncio que debido al invento de "incidente del grupo de espias" y a los freneticos ejercicios de guerra de agresion a la RPDC en el Sur de Corea, las relaciones intercoreanas se tornan conflictivas y se arrecia la lucha del pueblo coreano por el derecho a vivir.
					
					A su vez, Alejandro Cao de Benos subrayo que se solidarizara constantemente con la lucha de la FDNA y los habitantes surcoreanos por la implementacion de la historica Declaracion Conjunta Norte-Sur, la soberania, la democracia y la reunificacion.
					
					El hizo publica una declaracion para condenar los ejercicios militares "Ulji Freedom Guardian" EE.UU.-Sur de Corea.
					
					El documento califica tales ejercicios de accion criminal muy peligrosa y sostiene que las autoridades norteamericanas y surcoreanas deben abandonar la vana ilusion de reprimir a la RPDC con la fuerza.
					
					Anota que su entidad apoyara activamente la justa causa del pueblo coreano para defender la paz y la seguridad solidarizandose con todas las fuerzas progresistas del mundo y entidades anti-guerra por la paz.

articles.title: CRPP denuncia el complot anti-RPDC de Sur de Corea
articles.content:
CRPP denuncia el complot anti-RPDC de Sur de Corea

					Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Secretariado del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) hizo publica el dia 12 la informacion no. 978 denunciando la campana intrigante y conflictiva anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea que la capa militar del Sur de Corea arma diciendo que esta canoneo en el mar cercano a la isla Yongphyong.
					
					El documento senala:
					
					Como se ha informado ya, los belicistas titeres surcoreanos hicieron abruptamente el fuego de respuesta acusando absurdamente que la RPDC canoneo en el mar cercano a la isla Yonphyong.
					
					Aunque el jefe de la delegacion de la parte Norte de las conversaciones de trabajo militar Norte-Sur de Corea ha revelado la verdad del incidente y las tentativas malignas de los titeres surcoreanos, estos recurren de continuo a la campana intrigante diciendo que "es verdad que se oyo el sonido de explosion", "han comprobado precisamente los puntos de impacto de proyectiles a traves de los equipos de deteccion del sonido", etc.
					
					Cuando en el pasado hicimos el trabajo de voladura para la construccion de una central hidroelectrica en la provincia de Ryanggang, los titeres surcoreanos hablaron tanto de un "nube de hongo" y "ensayo nuclear". Y calificando un tronco, que flotaba en el Mar Este de Corea de un submarino del Norte, hicieron canonearlo y bombardearlo movilizando los buques de guerra y la aviacion. Esto produjo gran risa de todo el mundo.
					
					Cuando se hundio la corbeta surcoreana "Cheonan" en el ano pasado, publicaron que hayan detectado con radar el "submarino del Norte" que regresaba tras cumplir su mision, luego fue confirmada una bandada de pajaros, lo cual produjo irrision de todo el mundo. Hace poco, dispararon balas a su avion de pasajeros juzgandolo erroneamente como el "avion enemigo".
					
					El reciente canonazo no pasa de ser un complot semejante.
					
					Los titeres, enloquecidos por la confrontacion e intriga, no distinguen el sonido de voladura y canonazo.
					
					Es absurdo que los belicistas de la capa militar titere, que vigilan en serie durante 24 horas la zona de la parte Norte utilizando las armas de guerra y equipos de deteccion ultramodernos introducidos de su amo gringo, no distinguen el sonido de dinamitazo del lugar de roturacion de marismas en la isla de Ryongmae, situada a corta distancia desde la isla de Yonphyong.
					
					Es una payasada de que ellos insisten en que su detector acustico haya comprobado supuesto sonido de un proyectil del EPC que se caia en las cercanias de linea de limite al Norte, que ni siquiera fue lanzado.
					
					El presente caso de canonazo puso al desnudo que todos los "incidentes" inventados anteriormente por ellos oponiendose a la RPDC son farsas fraudulentas fabricadas de tal manera.
					
					Tales actos groseros muestran fehacientemente que los belicistas titeres estan enloquecidos por las maquinaciones de intriga, provocacion, confrontacion y guerra.
					
					Ultimamente, los titeres arman campanas de toda indole como el "incidente de grupo de espias" y el "envio de grupo de asesinato".
					
					Tal conspiracion de la banda de los titeres reside en echar aguas frias al ambiente de mejoramiento de relaciones intercoreanas que llegan a climax en visperas del 15 de agosto, mantener su politica de confrontacion, desviar la atencion sobre la crisis en el interior e impedir los esfuerzos por el alivio de tension de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					El presente incidente insinua que en la Peninsula Coreana se puede estallar la guerra tambien por motivo de un dinamitazo para la construccion pacifica.
					
					En las condiciones de que los belicistas de la capa militar titere concedieron a las unidades del frente  el derecho de "disparar sin preguntar", esta claro que la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana se hallara en catastrofe de guerra al momento si esos tipejos actuen tambien en el futuro como esta vez.
					
					Si los equipos de deteccion de fabricacion norteamericana, que tiene el ejercito titere, no  distinguen el dinamitazo y el canonazo, eso es tan peligroso.
					
					Hace poco, se produjo un gran escandalo al quedar descubierto el hecho de que estaban anotadas en el sistema de computadora de control de ordenes de la junta de jefes de estado mayor del ejercito titere decenas de unidades del ejercito titere ubicadas en las cercanias de la linea de demarcacion militar como si fueran estacionadas en las zonas del Norte de Corea.
					
					De veras, es terrible solo al pensar en las consecuencias catastroficas que ocasionara el alboroto intrigante de la banda titere.
					
					Parece que los belicistas titeres no estan en sus cables por el fanatismo de enfrentamiento y el delirio.
					
					Si la banda titere no desea su autodestruccion, debe poner fin a la estupida campana intrigante y complot de guerra de agresion contra la RPDC y actuar con prudencia.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela peligrosidad de "Ulji Freedom Guardian"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela peligrosidad de "Ulji Freedom Guardian"

					Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- Las autoridades surcoreanas intentan iniciar del 16 al 26 junto con Estados Unidos los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Ulji Freedom Guardian" de gran envergadura contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Los belicistas surcoreanos hablan de que el objetivo de ejercicios es para fortalecer el estado preparativo del combate de la "alianza" Sur de Corea-EE.UU. y superar todas las amenazas.  Pero, ellos no pueden ocultar con nada la agresividad y peligrosidad de los ejercicios.
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este viernes y continua:
					
					Estos ejercicios siendo una demostracion fehaciente de la invariable politica conflictiva anti-RPDC de los belicistas internos y externos devienen la abierta amenaza militar a la RPDC y el desafio flagrante a la paz de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Tambien muestran que ellos no desean el alivio de tension y la paz de la Peninsula Coreana sino persiguen realizar a toda costa su ambicion anti-RPDC en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					Con la aparicion del "poder" conservador del Sur de Corea, se han empeorado rapidamente las relaciones intercoreanas que se desarrollaban favorablemente despues del 15 de junio de 2000 y se agudizan cada dia mas. Bajo tal situacion, estos ejercicios agravaran mas la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y aumentaran el peligro de guerra nuclear.
					
					La historia muestra claramente que todos los ejercicios de cualesquier formas en el Sur de Corea llevan al empeoramiento las relaciones intercoreanas y crean graves dificultades en la realizacion de la causa de la reunificacion independiente y pacifica.
					
					Como la Representacion del Ejercito Popular de Corea en Phanmunjom reafirmo en el mensaje publico enviado recientemente a las autoridades norteamericanas y  surcoreanas, se debe suspenderse de inmediato el plan de ejercicios anti-RPDC que rompen el ambiente del dialogo y crean la confrontacion y la tension en la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: Chinos rechazan la "teoria de amenaza de China" de Japon
articles.content:
Chinos rechazan la "teoria de amenaza de China" de Japon

					Beijing, 11 de agosto (ACNC) -- Los especialistas chinos rechazaron la "teoria de amenaza de China" escrita en la recien publicada "carta blanca de defensa" de Japon.
					
					Un investigador del Instituto de Relaciones Internacionales Contemporaneas de China senalo que la "amenaza maritima" es el contenido importante de la "teoria de amenaza de China" proferido por Japon en su carta blanca de este ano y revelo que con este rumor, este pais isleno intenta sembrar entre los paises vecinos la conciencia de la "amenaza de China".
					
					El subdirector del Instituto de Asuntos Japoneses de la Academia de Ciencias Sociales de China insistio en que no existe la "coaccion" de China a Japon y EE.UU., especialmente a la alianza entre estos dos paises.
					
					Los especialistas insistieron unanimemente en que Japon no debe divulgar el hecho incorrecto ni suponer impertinentemente el futuro de las relaciones de los dos paises.
